Title: Perun State Channels
Description: We extend Perun State Channels in the Stellar ecosystem so they can utilize off-chain and cross-chain transactions.
Awarded Submissions: Perun State Channels, Perun Cross-Chain Swaps
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github
Team Description:
The PolyCrypt GmbH is a spin-off of the Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany. The team has extensive experience in applied cryptography and blockchain research as well as in software development. Core areas for our team include the research and development of interoperability and scalability solutions. In addition, our team members are the main developers of the Open-Source go-perun library and therefore provide over 5 years of experience specifically in developing software in the blockchain space. 

We have successfully built the Perun Channels SDK on Stellar during SCF#14 enabling developers to utilize Payment Channels for their applications. In SCF#24 we have successfully built and deployed a cross-chain swapping solution between Stellar and Ethereum.

Title: Stellarcarbon
Description: Stellarcarbon provides transparent nature-based carbon offsetting with proof of retirement on Stellar and in the Verra Registry. With Stellarcarbon, anyone with a Stellar account can do a voluntary carbon offset that is registered both on-chain and off-chain. We have been building the infrastructure needed to connect legacy carbon markets with the new digital economy taking place on public ledgers. Other companies building on Stellar are able to integrate our backend service into their products and services, to give users easy access to carbon offsets. On top of this infrastructure, Stellarcarbon itself wants to develop and launch a retail shop for carbon offsetting aimed at individuals and small businesses.
Open-Source?: Partly, I do have a public Github

Title: SocketFi
Description: SocketFi is a smart wallet and one-stop dApp built on the Stellar Lumen ecosystem and Soroban Blockchain. Designed to seamlessly connect millions of social media users to Web3, it provides access to hundreds of dApps and Web3 tools—all in one place.
Regions of Operation: North America (without Mexico),Middle East & North Africa,Sub-Saharan Africa,Europe & Central Asia
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github
Team Description:
The SocketFi team comprises four highly skilled developers with extensive experience in blockchain and decentralized application (dApp) development across multiple platforms, including Soroban, Solana, and EVM-compatible blockchains. Our team has worked on innovative DeFi solutions, including staking protocols, algorithmic money markets for permissionless overcollateralized loans, and multichain bridges utilizing advanced interoperability protocols and infrastructure.

Beyond DeFi, we’ve developed other types of dApps, such as GameFi applications, showcasing our versatility across blockchain use cases. At SocketFi, we are united in tackling industry challenges that slow Web3 adoption, developing solutions to drive growth and reduce friction in the blockchain ecosystem.

This dedication fuels our vision for SocketFi: to create a seamless pathway for millions to join Web3 using their social media accounts.

Team Description:
1) Gaël BOKONGO - CEO:

Gaël is the Co-Founder and CEO of Muwpay. He has a PhD in Financial Mathematics from the University of Minnesota and a BA in Finance from North Dakota State University. He also holds a Certificate of Alternative Finance from Harvard. With over a decade of experience in the energy market, Gaël honed his skills in commodities trading at ENGIE, a leading energy company, where he lived in 5 different countries including Turkey, Colombia, Singapore, France, and Italy. Additionally, he gained valuable experience working with major banks and stock exchanges such as The New York Stock Exchange, Bank of America, and BNP Paribas.

Apart from his financial background, Gaël is also a tech-entrepreneur and videographer who has traveled to 100+ countries, allowing him to gain a deep appreciation for world cultures. He founded EyesTale Studio, a production company that created content for renowned media companies such as Lonely Planet, National Geographyl and France Television.

In 2018, Gaël leveraged his professional background and passion for the crypto industry to create INGWAZ Studio, a WEB3 videogame company.

Linkedin : https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabbok/

2) Mohammed FRIHAT - CTO:

Mohamed is the co-founder and CTO of MUWPAY. He holds a PhD in Applied Mathematics from ENS Paris Saclay, a Master's degree in Mathematics from École Centrale Paris, a Master's degree in Finance from Paris Dauphine University and an MBA in Business Management & Administration from Sorbonne University.

With experience in various sectors such as gas, finance, and machine learning, Mohamed has worked with international companies like Gaztransport and Technigaz and has contributed to significant research centers such as CNRS. Over the last five years, he has focused on WEB3.0 and excelled in various projects in DeFi and NFT on multiple blockchains, including Ethereum, BSC, and Tezos.

Mohamed has a deep passion for different fields of mathematics. From financial mathematics to operational research, from fundamental Mathematics to applied mathematics and scientific computing Mohamed wanted to learn them all to solve real-world problems. As a result, Mohamed has a combined academic background in scientific computing (Master degree at @CentraleSupélec), applied mathematics (PhD at @École normale supérieure Paris-Saclay), Economics and Finance (Master Degree at @Université Paris Dauphine - PSL), Financial Mathematics (master’s degree at @Université Paris Cité) and MBA (@IAE Paris - Sorbonne Business School).At the start of his career, Mohamed worked as a data scientist at @Banque International Arabe de Tunisie. 

After that, Mohamed joined a Tunisian Industrial Group as an operational researcher for 4 years in order to optimize complex production processes using mathematical models, and Gaztransport & Technigaz (GTT) for 5 years as the R&D Researcher and Scientific Computing Engineer where he studied a very complicated physical problem “Sloshing” using both numerical simulations and experimental investigations. Moreover, Mohamed worked as a researcher on pricing models at different universities: he studied the local stochastic volatility models “LSV” at  LPSM Laboratory (Pierre and Marie Curie University) and the martingale optimal transport problem at CEREMADE Laboratory (Dauphine-PSL university).

Since 4 years ago, Mohamed has participated in DeFi projects, NFT marketplace projects, and P2E gaming projects as blockchain developer and researcher. Since April 2022, Mohamed has been Co-Head of DeFi at @PyratzLabs to build the DeFi Labs

Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mohamed-frihat-53a191201/

3) Xavier GOMEZ - COO:

Xavier is the co-founder and COO of MUWPAY, where he leverages his expertise in finance and fintech to drive the company's growth and success. He holds a Master's degree in Finance from the ISC and has also earned specialized certifications in Fintech (2016) and Cryptocurrency (2021) from the prestigious Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). He further honed his skills in private equity by graduating from HEC Paris.Before joining MUWPAY, Xavier co-founded INVYO, a cutting-edge data management start-up that employs machine learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to unlock the potential of big data in finance. 

He also served as a global multi-asset portfolio manager at Pictet & Cie, where he was responsible for global asset allocation and the implementation of European regulations (MIFID and FATCA). In his previous role as a Director and global banker at Credit Suisse, Xavier oversaw the operations of various departments in Investment Banking and Wealth Management, including Trading in London, Sales & Trading in Derivatives in Switzerland, and treasurer (Basle III) in Credit Suisse with operations in Geneva, London, Paris, and Zurich.

Xavier is a sought-after speaker in the fintech industry and is considered a global fintech influencer by Onalytica and Refinitiv. He frequently participates in prestigious fintech events such as the Paris Fintech Forum, Finovate Europe, Finnovation Africa, Open Banking World Congress, etc.

Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/xavier-gomez-xg/

4) Dhruv MALIK :

Dhruv is a Solution Architect and Backend Developer at MUWPAY. He holds a master's degree in cybersecurity from École Polytechnique and has gained extensive experience over the past three years working on various projects in the web3 space (e.g. Request , Equisafe , newOrder DAO , Baseline protocol and D/labs). Dhruv's expertise spans across public and permissioned blockchains, where he has excelled in smart contract development, technical writing, audits, and MVP dapp creation.

Outside of his primary responsibilities, Dhruv is an active member of the web3 developer community ecosystem with his role as leader of the Polygon France guild and contributor to the Kernel Block community. Dhruv spends his free time participating in blockchain related events and has won some such as the ethglobal hackmoney and gitcoin hackathons.

He is also an avid researcher and stays abreast of the latest developments in web3 technology such as ZkProof, ML use cases and DeFi adoption cases. He actively contributes to open-source projects and is committed to driving innovation in the blockchain industry. 

Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/dhruvthegr8/

5) Mélissandre MONATUS:

Mélissandre is the co-founder and CMO of MUWPAY. She has a diverse background in applied sciences for automated systems, marketing and media/communication.

She spent more than 15 years working in marketing, communication, media and events at an international level, including 8 years in London where she worked for major video game publishers such as Activision Blizzard, Capcom, power tool manufacturers (Black&Decker) and media companies (DDB Agency). 

She then continued her experience in Paris mainly in the indie video game industry working on MOBA games, the esport field and within indie studios for the European and African markets.

Since 2019, she has been teaching marketing, business, and event management in high schools. In 2021, she continues her work within the WEB3 industry in the field of video games and fintech.

6) Cédric MAGNE:

After many years in e-commerce, Cédric accessed the Blockchain fields in early 2019, working on NFT marketing projects developing smart contracts on Ethereum, Solidity and Javascript. Title: Convexity Humanitarian Aid Transfer Solution (CHATS)
Description: CHATS offers blockchain-based cash and voucher solutions to improve programs by MercyCorps, UNICEF  and other iNGOs partners and donors to ensure transparent, secure, and efficient aid distribution.
Awarded Submissions: A pilot with MercyCorps Mauritania to demonstrate the viability of CHATS for use in the USAID funded Nafoore Initiative, as well as other MercyCorps and UNICEF programs across West and Northern Africa.
Open-Source?: Partly, I do have a public Github
Team Description:
Convexity Technologies is a Nigerian-based web3 solutions company known for leveraging blockchain to enhance transparency, especially in humanitarian aid and financial transactions. Founded by Adedeji Owonibi and Charles Okaformbah in 2021, Convexity has since gained some global recognition for its solutions, including CHATS.

We currently are thirty three (33) full time team members, including a Certified Enterprise Architect, Certified Cloud Engineers,  Chartered Accountants (CNA; ACA), Certified Fraud Examiners (CFE), Certified Cryptocurrency Compliance Specialists (CCS), Lawyers (B.L; LL.B), and Senior Forensics Consultants. Our team members have contributed to various global initiatives such as the Digital Euro Association, KYC/AML/CFT Working Group, Global Digital Finance, SEC's Virtual Assets & Fintech Regulatory Framework Drafting Committee and The Director of Investigations and Compliance for the Cryptographic Development Initiative of Nigeria (CDIN).

Some projects we’ve built include: 
1. We designed the GIGA Connectivity marketplace, an Initiative of UNICEF and the International Telecommunications Union (ITU) to provide internet connectivity to every school in the world by creating a marketplace for Governments and Internet Service Providers (ISPs) to trade services and incentives. 
2. Central Bank of Nigeria’s CBDC Upgrade: We built a wallet and transaction system for the disbursement of $800 million (USD) to 5 million beneficiaries through the Federal Ministry of Humanitarian and Disasters Management.
3. Emtech CBDC Platform: We developed Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC), Central Bank Fintech Sandbox for startups and cross-border payment platforms currently in use by several Central Banks.
4. We developed and own Africa’s first regulated stablecoin issuing platform, the https://cngn.co as well as an Automated Multichain Transfer protocol (AMTP) allowing users to execute seamless cross-chain transactions; a custom MPC wallets that’s been white-labeled by several of our Government and enterprise clients. 
5. Compliance-as-a-Service product (CaaS) for Web3 startups - https://caaservice.io/ 
6. Aeropaye - https://aeropaye.com/ - An automated system to process refund claims on the Aeropaye refund engine within seconds of delayed or cancelled flight.
7. HouseAfrica - https://houseafrica.io - A blockchain & NFT-powered system using satellite mapping to verify, select and purchase digital titles to landed property.
8. Chainkeeping - https://chainkeeping.com/ - A web3 taxation and accounting solution for individuals, businesses, accountants and governments.
9. VesselTrust - https://vesseltrust.com/ - A blockchain-based marketplace for trading petroleum commodities and renewable energy.
10. Fintech NGR - https://nfw.fintechng.org/ - We built a website for the Fintech Association of Nigeria, an association of financial institutions, fintechs, and financial industry players.
11. Umrah Cash - https://www.umrahcash.com/ - A platform that provides hajj pilgrims a wallet to deposit local currency and withdraw SAR in Saudi Arabia.
12. MojaaEx: A licensed web3-based security exchange platform in Nigeria
13. Scrybit - Scrybit is a cutting-edge cryptocurrency wallet designed to revolutionise the way individuals manage their digital assets. With a primary focus on security, usability, and versatility, Scrybit aims to provide a seamless and user-friendly experience for crypto enthusiasts and investors alike.

Jose and Joseph are excited to announce they have handed in their notices and left their full-time jobs to focus on Freelii full-time, operating from the Philippines starting December 2024.

Jose is the founding engineer at Atrato, a leading BNPL solution backed by Y Combinator and Accel. Since its founding in 2019, Atrato has rapidly grown by leveraging advanced technology developed by Jose to underwrite loans in real time, offering fast, affordable financing options for physical and online stores. A three-time Stellar Hackathon winner, Jose is now the CTO of Freelii.

Joseph brings extensive experience in traditional finance, including investment banking, wealth management, and hedge funds. Seeking greater excitement, he transitioned to fintech in London, working at Cashflows before being recruited by Checkout.com as their youngest Account Manager. At Checkout.com, he manages over $350M in monthly transactions and generated $1M in ARR within his first year. Joseph also contributed to the GTM strategy for Southeast Asia's largest microfinancing company and is now focused on using his nonprofit and financial expertise to support underbanked markets.

Jose and Joseph met at the Stellar x EasyA Meridian London Hackathon, bonding over their shared passion for DeFi. Joseph driven by real-world applications and Jose by the underlying technology. Both were seeking to transition to DeFi full-time, a topic that naturally arose during post-hackathon and post conference discussions.

Following the event, they spent five intensive days together and decided to partner on Freelii. Their first product sprint at the "Funding the Commons Hackathon" resulted in Freelii winning first place.

Title: Reyts - Stablecoin-Powered P2P Fiat DEX
Description: ​Reyts operates a peer-to-peer currency exchange platform rooted in a community-first philosophy, emphasizing loyalty and trust to foster strong relationships with our users. We are committed to passing on maximum savings to our community; the more efficient our systems become, the more we can reduce costs for our users. To enhance our platform capabilities at Reyts, we plan to integrate with the Stellar Network, leveraging its decentralized infrastructure to improve liquidity, speed, and efficiency. By implementing The Stellar Path Payment Strict Send operation, we aim to facilitate seamless fiat transactions without requiring users to directly handle stablecoins. This integration will make underserved currencies more globally accessible, reducing the high costs traditionally associated with servicing them. Through these enhancements, Reyts seeks to provide a borderless, low-cost, and instant currency exchange experience, further empowering our users in the global financial landscape.

Title: Spinach
Description: Spinach helps projects and chains grow DEX liquidity by running liquidity competitions for builders within their ecosystem.  Spinach started in response to witnessing flaws in two leading ecosystem growth methods: 1. Grant funding for builders - works great at first, but many builders struggle to secure follow-up funding 2. Liquidity incentives (e.g. merkl.xyz) - work too well. Whales bridge over to farm incentives, but vanish within 48 hours once incentives stop  To sustainably bind users and liquidity providers to your ecosystem you need to go beyond these growth methods. Enter Spinach’s retrofunding liquidity competitions for builders.  Using Spinach you can launch competitions as follows: 1. Choose token whose liquidity you want to grow 2. Allocate a daily incentive budget 3. Announce to projects they can get part of this incentive budget by orchestrating liquidity against their token and the incentivized token 4. Projects then rally their community to grow this liquidity 5. On a daily basis at midnight, Spinach calculates the liquidity orchestrated per participating project; and 6. Then retroactively distributes rewards to the projects proportional to the liquidity they orchestrated per day  In early testing, we found Spinach has 3 benefits over direct liquidity incentives: 1. Noise machine - projects and their communities actively promote the competition 2. Core community - participants are true fans of your ecosystem and are here for the longterm 3. 2nd-order effects - projects often launch direct liquidity incentive programs of their own  This creates a positive-sum flywheel where everyone wins—the chain, its builders, the community, and the broader ecosystem.  In Q2 ‘25 we’ll launch Spinach MVP to allow anyone to launch liquidity competitions for builders.
Regions of Operation: No specific region of operation,North America (without Mexico),Europe & Central Asia
Awarded Submissions: Liquid retrofunding that grows DEX TVL
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github

Title: Seevcash
Description: SeevCash is a mobile financial platform designed to serve the unbanked and underserved communities by reducing transaction fees and providing digital tools to manage finances more effectively.  Launched in March 2023, the app has already gained over 14,200 users and offers features like an expense tracker, budgeting, price comparisons, Peer to Peer sending and request money. It also recently introduced gamification elements where users can watch ads to earn SeevCoins, which offset their transaction costs.  The integration of Stellar’s blockchain elevates the platform by enabling fast, low-cost cross-border payments and offering stablecoins like USDC, making it easier for users to convert digital assets into local currencies. With Stellar, SeevCash aims to broaden its reach across Africa and people living in abroad, facilitating seamless on-ramping and off-ramping through local payment channels. This blockchain integration will allow SeevCash to provide users with more stable financial options and lower fees, enhancing the platform's usability and impact.   By combining blockchain technology and ad-revenue gamification, SeevCash is creating an ecosystem that not only addresses users' financial needs but also provides them with opportunities to earn while managing their money more efficiently.

Title: IRL
Description: IRL: A Global Loyalty Layer for Culture - IRL is building a decentralized loyalty platform that rewards people for showing up in real life — at clubs, galleries, festivals, and cultural venues. By blending check-ins, perks, and onchain identity, IRL enables users to earn rewards and tokens simply by participating in culture. Our vision is to create a global cultural graph that connects attendance with long-term value, using blockchain to turn presence into proof — and proof into perks.  With Stellar, IRL will launch the next phase of its ecosystem by integrating Stellar-based payment rails and token rewards into the IRL dApp. This will allow users around the world to claim perks, earn loyalty points, and eventually receive token-based incentives using fast, affordable, and globally accessible infrastructure.  Our technical implementation involves issuing IRL Points via check-in events, quests, and community campaigns — and enabling those points to be redeemed for perks backed by Stellar-native assets (USDC or $IRL token). A lightweight backend layer will support wallet creation, identity-linked check-ins, and a reward engine for automated redemption. Partners such as venues, festivals, and brands will access a dashboard that allows them to issue and track rewards, creating a scalable, community-led flywheel.  This initiative will drive Stellar adoption through tens of thousands of culturally engaged users, while proving out real-world loyalty applications for onchain incentives. With support from the Stellar Community Fund, IRL will activate new cities, onboard creators and venues, and demonstrate the power of culture as an onramp to Web3.
Awarded Submissions: IRL: Global Loyalty Protocol for Culture
Open-Source?: Not yet, I don’t have a Github yet but my project will be open-source

Title: Lul-Serving the unbanked
Description: This is a previously initially funded project. Our apps aids financially underserved refugees and unbanked individuals in sub-Saharan Africa. Many Africans lack adequate banking. For example, 350 Million people are unbanked in Sub-Saharan Africa. Also, Millions of refugees don’t have financial access. Refugees often encounter hurdles accessing traditional banking due to language barriers, documentation challenges, and unfamiliarity with other financial options.   Our app, utilizing Stellar, tackles these issues by providing vital services like remittance, digital wallets, payments, crowd funding, rotating savings and credit associations, and virtual cards. These solutions are crafted to offer refugees and unbanked individuals secure and affordable access to financial services, bolstering their financial inclusion and stability.         Now we have been funded Initial funding in previous round of SCF # 29. We were supposed to deliver basic payment and remittance functionality. We have done that. Additionally after we were recommended to  show traction after we applied for #35, we have launched closed beta with 125 users and have gotten rave response and people are already using this app. And we want to progress to the next phase of development, which is developing, the remaining functionalities, such as crowd funding, rotating savings and credit associations, and virtual cards,  and launch on Testnet.
Awarded Submissions: Lul-Serving the unbanked, Finance Access for Refugees and Unbanked

Title: Stellar Merch Shop
Description: We propose building the official Stellar merch platform: a global, community-driven hub combining high-quality physical products with blockchain-native features. Currently, Stellar invests heavily in high-quality merch for events, but there is no online access, no global availability, and no unified system—merch can only be collected on-site, excluding much of the community. The platform will offer: A Shopify-based front-end for seamless e-commerce, integrated with a custom backend connected to Soroban. Responsible, localized sourcing through verified suppliers on each continent to ensure ethical production, reduced shipping impact, and top-tier quality. A network of verified suppliers per continent to ensure high-quality, local production and faster delivery. NFT tokenization of merch, offering proof of authenticity, limited-edition ownership, and potential utility (e.g., event access, community status). A creator royalty system, empowering independent designers and ecosystem contributors to earn from every sale and resale. A DAO or voting layer, to co-select new drops, styles, and collaborations.   Beyond Stellar-branded drops, the platform will support ecosystem projects in launching their own merch lines boosting visibility, rewarding users, and building project identity through physical and digital goods. This initiative is not just about clothing, it’s about activating the Stellar ecosystem through accessible, collectible, and meaningful experiences. By blending fashion, blockchain, and community participation, we aim to deliver a scalable and premium Web3-native solution. Our goal is to become Stellar’s official and exclusive merchandising partner, helping the network engage its global audience while showcasing real-world utility for the Stellar blockchain.
Open-Source?: Not yet, I don’t have a Github yet but my project will be open-source

Title: Rubic
Description: This integration will connect Stellar to Rubic’s aggregation infrastructure, allowing users to access the best available rates for Stellar-based assets through live DEXs and bridges already operating on Stellar. Rubic will onboard these providers into its platform, giving broader visibility and easier access to Stellar. New providers can also be added over time, creating an open path for expanding access without rebuilding infrastructure. As a key part of integration, Rubic will implement multihop swaps for Stellar, allowing any-to-any token exchanges with efficient routing. Custom smart contracts and a dedicated mechanism will be developed to support this feature. For Stellar-based projects, this opens the door to seamless integration of same-chain and cross-chain swaps through Rubic’s API, SDK, or widget. No need to build in-house solutions or maintain bridge logic because Rubic handles that layer. This removes integration overhead, unifies liquidity access, and gives developers and users a smoother experience across Stellar and beyond.
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github

Title: AIDA
Description: AIDA is an AI-powered multi-chain platform that combines three core modules: Trading Terminal, MindSharing, and LaunchZone, and enables users to create, analyze, and trade tokens — including RWA, AI, MEME, and GameFi — in real time across multiple blockchains. With Stellar integration, AIDA will make issuing and promoting Stellar-native tokens seamless and accessible, and Stellar assets will gain equal visibility within our trading terminal, analytics engine, and KOL campaign system, giving developers and traders the same opportunities as projects on other chains. The Trading Terminal features a multi-DEX aggregator with best execution, now including Stellar DEX liquidity, unified charts and pair discovery where Stellar tokens appear alongside other assets, and AI-driven market scanning to identify trends and opportunities for Stellar tokens. MindSharing is a KOL campaign engine tailored for Stellar projects, offering transparent reward pools in XLM or custom Stellar tokens, and works for both Pre-TGE and Post-TGE projects with instant, low-cost payouts via Stellar. LaunchZone is a no-code token creation suite for Stellar-based tokens, enabling fast listing and liquidity pool setup for Stellar assets, with native integration with the AIDA wallet, campaign engine, and trading terminal, providing a full cycle for Stellar projects to create, launch, promote, and trade.
Regions of Operation: South Asia,East Asia & Pacific,Europe & Central Asia

Title: CoopStable v2 - Yield sharing stablecoin
Description: CoopStable (Solidarity Funding for Stellar) is a yield-sharing stablecoin protocol designed to support builders creating real-world impact on Stellar. Built on the Stellar network, CoopStable enables pooled funds to generate sustainable on-chain yield—giving projects and initiatives a decentralized way to fund themselves and others.  Following the successful launch of a working V1 prototype, CoopStable V2 marks a major step forward. Powered by Soroban smart contracts, V2 focuses on scalability, ease of use, and deeper capital efficiency—bringing cooperative-style finance to the builders shaping Stellar’s future.  Key upgrades in V2 include:  Multiple Yield Sources: In addition to Blend Capital’s USDC pool, V2 integrates protocols like UltraCapital’s yUSD, optimizing returns for builders and community funders.  Automated Cohort Creation: Soroban-based logic enables seamless group formation, reducing manual overhead and improving onboarding for aligned projects and contributors.  Liquidity Provider (LP) Incentives & Gamification: Users minting cUSD earn points redeemable for builder-aligned rewards. A lottery feature adds engagement while increasing funding opportunities.  Improved Frontend UX: A redesigned mobile-first interface makes it easier to discover, compare, and join funding cohorts based on project goals, timelines, and yield expectations.  CoopStable V2 gives Stellar-based builders the tools to bootstrap and sustain meaningful work. From neighborhood development to digital inclusion projects, CoopStable makes funding collaborative, regenerative, and mission-aligned.  This is not just a stablecoin—it’s funding infrastructure for the builders of Stellar’s real-world economy.
Awarded Submissions: A yield bearing stablecoin for Stellar ecosystem projects
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github
Team Description:
Sourdough Systems is a seasoned development shop specializing in DeFi and blockchain-native solutions. The core team behind CoopStable brings a complementary blend of product design, technical depth, and project execution:

-   0xR – UI/UX designer and sociologist, serving as product lead and CoopStable’s user experience architect. With a background in both Web3 design and social systems, 0xR ensures the interface aligns with cooperative financial behavior.

Beyond the core team, Sourdough Systems maintains a broader network of highly-skilled smart contract engineers, front-end developers, and researchers who are readily available to scale development capacity as needed. With a proven track record in launching successful decentralized applications and social-impact-driven protocols, the team is well-positioned to deliver on the vision of CoopStable.

Title: PayZoll
Description: PayZoll – Crypto native payouts Infrastructure on Stellar.   PayZoll is building the decentralized Stripe for Web3, a modular, intelligent, and production-ready payments stack that unifies crypto and fiat transactions under one seamless roof. Built for scalability and grounded in real-world usability, PayZoll bridges blockchain rails with traditional finance, starting where it’s needed most: emerging markets.    With Stellar's infrastructure at its core, we're building tools that are simple, secure, and scalable — unlocking Web3 finance for the next billion users.     Technical Implementation :   Main website : https://www.payzoll.xyz ,  Stellar Testnet Integrated Website(Stellar Build Better Hackathon) : https://payzoll-stellar.onrender.com   1. Bulk Transaction Contracts (Soroban) - Rust-based Soroban contract that ingests a payroll manifest (list of recipients + amounts) and executes all PaymentOps in one atomic transaction. - Role-based access control baked into the contract: only registered “employer” keys can submit batch jobs, and “auditor” keys can read execution logs. - On-chain validation of token trustlines and sufficient balances before dispatch, preventing partial failures mid-batch.    2. Multi-Hop Swap Mechanism - Soroban integration with Stellar AMM pools: our contract queries the best XLM⇄USDC (or custom-asset) path via on-chain price oracles and executes the swap immediately prior to payouts. - Optimal route discovery using the Soroban Rust SDK’s path-finding APIs, ensuring minimal slippage and predictable token conversions. - Seamless in-contract settlement: swapped funds are forwarded directly into the batch payment flow, so employers only need to fund XLM (or any single asset) and the contract handles the rest.    3. Enhanced Frontend Experience - Next.js + Tailwind UI that leverages the Stellar JS SDK and Freighter wallet for: - Real-time transaction dashboards via Horizon streaming (payment success/failure, swap quotes). - Interactive batch submission form with on-the-fly validation of recipient addresses, asset balances, and estimated network fees. - One-click payroll trigger: employers upload a CSV, review the swap rate & fee summary, then dispatch the entire payroll in a single confirmation.
Open-Source?: No, my project does not need to be open-source, now or in the future

Title: Venalabs
Description: At VenaLabs, we believe the best way to learn Web3 is through hands-on practice. Instead of passively watching or reading, users actively engage with real blockchain concepts through gamified and interactive experiences.    Our platform is structured like a video game: users follow learning maps that simulate real on-chain actions. Each map focuses on a specific blockchain, introducing core concepts step by step. As they progress, users unlock new maps and challenges, earning on-chain certifications minted as NFTs to validate their achievements.    To simplify complex topics, we include mini-games that turn abstract ideas into fun, interactive exercises. Once users are ready, they can take on Airdrop Conquests—real-world quests that let them apply what they’ve learned and earn tangible rewards.    With the help of AI-powered virtual mentors offering guidance and feedback along the way, VenaLabs turns blockchain education into an immersive and practical journey, giving learners the tools they need to confidently navigate the Web3 space

Title: Alternun
Description: Redefine gold as a force for good preserving wealth while regenerating the planet. ALTERNUN envisions a future where certified, unmined gold resources secure value for investors and fuel community led restoration projects.  Objectives:  Inflation Protection: Deliver a liquid, gold-backed digital asset (GBT) that retains purchasing power against rising prices.  Environmental Stewardship: Keep gold underground to eliminate mining’s carbon footprint and ecological damage.  Ecosystem Engagement: Enable GBT holders to propose, vote on, and support regenerative initiatives, sharing in both social impact and financial upside.  Decentralized Governance: Empower ATN token stakeholders to steer protocol evolution, treasury allocation, and project selection through a transparent DAO.  Technical Implementation  Tokenization of Resources: Leverage NI 43-101–certified gold resources as collateral to mint GBT on the Stellar blockchain.  Smart Contracts & MRV: Deploy Soroban smart contracts for minting, burning, staking, and on-chain Monitoring, Reporting, and Verification (MRV) of funded projects.  Treasury & Rewards: Channel minting fees and transaction revenues into a decentralized treasury; distribute ATN rewards to participants and allocate funds to vetted regenerative programs.  DAO Framework: Use ATN governance tokens for proposal submission, quorum-based voting, and dynamic parameter adjustments—ensuring community ownership and protocol resilience.

Title: Coala Pay Billy Wallet
Description: Stellar is utilizing a unique payments platform to conduct group cash transfers and offramps using stable coins. This use case functions well where internet phone connectivity exists, and offramp providers are utilizing the Stellar ecosystem. In locations where offramp providers are scarce, and online connectivity challenged, Coala Pay will adapt the use of its Billy Wallet to facilitate last mile payments. In this instance, Billy will be brought onto mainnet to be compatible with Aid Assist, as an Aid Assist host. Coala Pay will utilize a QR code reconciliation system and vendor network to facilitate the last mile payments to Stellar Aid Assist transactions.
Regions of Operation: Latin America & Caribbean,East Asia & Pacific,Middle East & North Africa,Sub-Saharan Africa

Title: DomiPago
Description: DomiPago is a cross-border remittance platform committed to transforming how Dominican families send and receive money. Our vision is to eliminate the high fees, long delays, and complex processes often found in traditional transfers, ensuring vital support arrives swiftly and securely. By leveraging RTPs and Stablecoin rails, we provide near-instant settlement and transparent, low-cost transactions.  Through an intuitive web interface and WhatsApp integration, users can initiate and confirm transfers in under 60 seconds, drastically enhancing convenience. On the receiving end, DomiPago partners with local banks, mobile wallets, and cash pickup locations throughout the Dominican Republic to streamline off-ramps and accommodate varying user preferences. Ultimately, DomiPago’s mission is to empower the Dominican diaspora by bridging economic gaps and offering a faster, more affordable remittance option.

This gives DomiPago a unique advantage in navigating compliance, integrating on/off-ramps, and crafting user experiences that build trust in emerging financial solutions.

The team’s on-the-ground presence in the Dominican Republic and across the diaspora in the US and Europe gives them direct access to both sides of the remittance equation—allowing for rapid iteration, customer feedback loops, and true product-market fit. Title: LumenShade: privacy pools
Description: This project proposes building a privacy pools protocol on the Stellar network, enabling privacy-preserving asset transfers while maintaining the potential for regulatory compliance.  Inspired by initiatives like 0xbow’s Privacy Pools, the goal is to offer users the ability to break transaction linkability using zero-knowledge proofs.  Integrating privacy pools into Stellar will enhance the network’s appeal to privacy-conscious users and institutions, unlock shielded payments, and lay the foundation for compliant, private DeFi on Stellar.  The project will proceed in two phases:  1. Phase 1: Deliver a fully functional privacy pool with private deposits and withdrawals. 2. Phase 2: Introduce optional compliance mechanisms such as user-defined association sets and selective disclosure, aligning with regulatory expectations.
Open-Source?: Not yet, I don’t have a Github yet but my project will be open-source
Team Description: We are 3 people specialized in cryptography and blockchain development: teddav (https://x.com/0xteddav), oba (https://x.com/obatirou) and alex (not a lot of online presence).

Title: TuCambio Wallets
Description: TuCambio´s Wallet is a Stellar-based API on/off-ramp infrastructure that facilitates real-time integration with local banking systems. That enables users to send money between countries directly to their bank accounts in seconds and at low cost. Recipients can instantly convert received crypto into local fiat currency, allowing them to access and spend funds as needed, without exposure to currency devaluation. Recipients will be able to receive the funds in a non-custodial, interoperable, and fully decentralized wallet. Funds are converted into USDC at the origin and can be instantly converted to fiat at the destination. This functionality includes automated wallet creation, activation via XLM, trustlines for USDC, and a secure interface where the user retains control of their private key. This implementation, fully based on Stellar, enables a unique combination of crypto and fiat: thanks to our API ramps with local banking connections in Chile, Peru, Colombia, Venezuela, Argentina, Bolivia, United States and Panama. We are also in the process of signing a contract that will enable connections with ramps in over 160 countries. Currently, we are a validated startup in the market: we have over 14,000 clients available for immediate wallet deployment. This positions TuCambio Wallets as a real financial inclusion solution powered by Stellar.
Regions of Operation: Latin America & Caribbean,Europe & Central Asia,North America (without Mexico)
Open-Source?: Not yet, I don’t have a Github yet but my project will be open-source
Team Description: TuCambio.app is led by Carla Leal (CEO/CPO), an engineer specialized in product development, artificial intelligence, and a serial founder. Carla previously founded and scaled an e-commerce venture that reached customers across North America, Asia, and Oceania. Luis Saavedra (COO/CFO) is a cryptocurrency, trading, and finance expert with 15 years of experience. He began his journey in the crypto world in 2015 by building his own mining farm in Venezuela. Together, they designed and operate the current infrastructure and lead the technical and strategic roadmap. Title: AgTrail: Stellar Food Traceability
Description: AgTrail is a tech-enabled food traceability solution empowering mid-level farmers in Nigeria with end-to-end visibility of their products—from planting to consumption. By integrating Stellar blockchain, AgTrail ensures immutable, transparent records of every stage in the supply chain while enabling seamless, low-cost cross-border payments from premium markets.  Vision: Build Africa’s most trusted, transparent, and accessible agricultural supply chain, where farmers receive fair value, consumers trust their food, and compliance with global food safety standards is seamless.  Objectives:  Provide farmers real-time tracking via IoT devices and QR codes.  Ensure compliance with NAFDAC, EU, and FDA FSMA standards to unlock premium market access.  Enable secure, instant payments using Stellar’s blockchain infrastructure.  Deliver actionable, data-driven insights to reduce waste, improve efficiency, and boost profitability.  Technical Implementation: AgTrail uses IoT sensors and farmer-input data to capture key supply chain details, hashed and stored on Stellar blockchain for security and traceability. Each product batch is assigned a unique QR code, enabling processors, regulators, and consumers to instantly verify its journey. Stellar’s payment rails facilitate direct, low-cost transactions from verified buyers, with AgTrail acting as an intermediary to channel payments to farmers who are not digitally savvy.  By combining blockchain-powered traceability with financial inclusion, AgTrail positions African farmers as globally competitive and compliant, bridging trust gaps, improving food safety, and driving sustainable growth across agricultural markets.
Open-Source?: No, my project does not need to be open-source, now or in the future
Team Description:

Title: Kasi Money
Description: Kasi Money is a digital banking platform for gig workers, freelancers, and the 2 out of 3 South African workers who earn irregular income. We are the official banking partner for Bolt, South Africa’s largest ride hailing platform. Our customers receive fiat based bank accounts and debit cards to receive income and spend. Uniquely, Kasi Money also extends short term lending and lets users auto invest a percentage of each income deposit into a money market fund to earn yield.  Today, over 40% of our 50k+ customers are migrant workers from other African countries. The most requested feature by this segment is the ability to send money home faster and more affordably, because we are already their financial home. Instead of withdrawing funds, going to another provider and paying 5-10% in fees.  This project enables those remittances using USDC on Stellar. Kasi Money acts as the onramp, converting fiat balances into USDC via Valr and loading it into Crossmint wallets. From there, recipients receive instant cash out access via MoneyGram’s global payout network. All blockchain complexity is abstracted. The user simply selects a recipient, confirms an amount, and their family receives an SMS with pickup instructions at a local MoneyGram counter.  We are building this on Stellar for its speed, low transaction costs, and seamless MoneyGram integration. This grant will support rollout of our first two corridors: Malawi and the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), key sender regions where our customer base is already concentrated and where remittance costs are especially high.
Open-Source?: No, my project does not need to be open-source, now or in the future

Title: QuillTip: Publishing and Microtipping
Description: QuillTip is a decentralized publishing platform that empowers writers to truly own their content while enabling sustainable monetization through Stellar’s low fees. Unlike existing Web3 publishing platforms hampered by high gas costs, QuillTip leverages Stellar to enable micro-monetization features like micro-tips—creating the first viable tip-per-highlight economy. Writers will mint articles as NFTs on Soroban, store content permanently on Arweave, and retain full ownership without platform lock-in. Readers can support creators directly through micro-tips, collect articles as NFTs, or subscribe in future, with 97.5% of revenue going to writers (vs. 30–50% on traditional platforms). Through seamless wallet integration, our mission is to democratize publishing by making content ownership accessible and monetization sustainable. Potential Impact: QuillTip aims to generate thousands of micro-transactions on Stellar each month—projected 10k+ tips and $5k+ in creator payouts within the first 6–9 months—driving real XLM and USDC flow, active addresses, and sustainable creator revenue.
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github

Title: Hurupay Virtual Accounts Program
Description: Hurupay proposes to launch a virtual accounts program for freelancers, remote workers and businesses that will leverage the USDC stablecoin on Stellar as the underlying infrastructure. The goal is to provide these users with a dedicated US account and routing number in their name to accept payroll from platforms like Deel and Remote, or payouts from services like YouTube, Spotify, and TikTok.This functionality will operate as follows: Each remote worker will have their virtual account linked to their Stellar wallet address. An employer in the US will make USD payment to the virtual account and the payment is settled into the user's wallet as USDC stablecoin. Users can then decide to hold their funds in stablecoins on their wallets or quickly and easily offramp local currency.
Open-Source?: No, my project does not need to be open-source, now or in the future

Title: Juntta: Web3 Crowdfunding for LATAM
Description: Juntta is the first transparent crowdfunding platform built in Peru, addressing the trust gap in digital fundraising across Latin America. It allows individuals, NGOs, and companies to launch verified campaigns in minutes, share their stories with images and updates, display real-time progress, and publish a complete donor list. Donations currently flow through local payment rails (Yape, Plin, bank transfers) and credit/debit cards, both domestic and international. After winning the Stellar Ideathon 2025, we developed a working prototype that connects traditional payment methods with a blockchain-ready backend. With SCF Build, Juntta will integrate the Stellar network to bring full on-chain transparency to donations and fund management. Each contribution will trigger a transaction on Stellar, generating a verifiable record stored in the public ledger and displayed on a real-time dashboard. Smart contracts built on Soroban will escrow donations, automate milestone-based releases, and record fund movement between wallets. A custom API layer will index blockchain data, synchronize it with Juntta’s Web2 interface, and allow third parties—such as NGOs or CSR programs—to connect seamlessly. Our MVP focuses on verified social impact campaigns in Peru, aiming to digitize a market that remains mostly offline. Upcoming features include Juntta Rifas, a transparent raffle tool for NGOs and creators, and Juntta Empresas, built for companies running CSR initiatives. Stellar’s low-cost, borderless infrastructure will enable expansion across LATAM. Led by a multidisciplinary team in fintech, social impact, and software engineering, Juntta’s mission is to rebuild trust in digital giving and make transparent fundraising accessible to everyone in Latin America.
Open-Source?: Not yet, I don’t have a Github yet but my project will be open-source

Title: HedgePay
Description: DeFi offers better yields than traditional banks, but most people never access it because onboarding is confusing and overly technical. Hedgepay solves that by turning DeFi into a simple, mobile self-banking experience built for users in Latin America.  At its core, Hedgepay is a self-custodial wallet that gives users direct access to stablecoin savings and curated DeFi investments. There are no seed phrases, gas fees, or complicated setup. Users can fund their account through local bank transfers or Pix, convert to USDC, and invest in vetted DeFi products through the Invest tab. Portfolio performance and withdrawals are displayed clearly inside the app.  Behind the scenes, Hedgepay uses secure key abstraction and transaction automation so users can interact with DeFi without managing blockchain details. All operations run on Stellar and Soroban, providing fast, low-cost access to global liquidity.  Future updates will add virtual debit cards linked to USDC balances and virtual ACH and IBAN accounts, allowing users to spend or move funds internationally without leaving the app.  Hedgepay’s goal is to make saving and investing in digital dollars as easy as using a bank app, giving people in emerging markets real access to stable income and financial independence.

Title: Loop - Cashback Everywhere with Stellar
Description: Loop reimagines everyday spending by combining the discounts, flexibility and global acceptance of gift cards with the power of blockchain-enabled payments. Users instantly access discounted digital gift cards to shop with merchants across the US, Canada, the UK, and Western Europe. We make savings seamless, global, and inclusive by rewarding customers for how they pay and encourage adoption of innovative financial rails while delivering immediate value at the checkout. Stellar payments empower us to offer significant cashback, passing on the savings from this optimal payment rail and the discounts we receive from suppliers. USDC cashback is delivered instantly to the integrated Stellar passkey wallet. We provide instant, borderless access to savings every time users shop, drive adoption of Stellar as a fast, low-cost, interoperable settlement layer through fantastic discounts, and deliver a frictionless user experience that works across web, mobile, and in-store environments. From a technical perspective, we integrate Stellar for instantly settled on-chain payments, accepting XLM, USDC, and EURC. Users receive instant cashback in USDC to their passkey based wallet. We also enable fast onboarding to Stellar with integrated on-ramps, enabling us to win organic users at any level of blockchain familiarity. For gift cards we integrate leading gift card suppliers: Blackhawk, Incomm, SVS, Tillo, Runa. Through these we have access to hundreds of top merchants covering 300k+ store locations. Finally in addition to the gift card programme we'll offer a cash back mastercard/visa card ensuring users can spend and save anywhere.
Open-Source?: Partly, I do have a public Github
Team Description: Loop is the consumer facing project by the team behind CTX.com, a crypto payments processor that's processed over $1m of payments. Our co-founders are Ash Francis and Alex Cox. Ash & Alex have built comprehensive crypto payment solutions and contributed to both THORChain and Maya Protocol (decentralized cross-chain exchanges). Prior to becoming full time blockchain developers in 2017, Ash was Head of Digital at an automotive start-up and Alex was dev-ops lead at an enterprise VoIP provider. In addition we're supported by a few external resources assisting in engineering, business functions and fractional general counsel.

Title: BPV StellarMesh Anchor
Description: BP Ventures, a trusted, longtime Stellar integration partner, Stellar validator, and Circle Alliance member, proposes connecting Mesh—a leading aggregator of 300+ crypto exchanges—via our Anchor solution to the Stellar network.  This integration enables seamless funding of Stellar wallets using the Mesh API, allowing users to transact directly from their exchange accounts without leaving their wallets, leveraging SEP-24 and other Stellar protocols.  Leading Stellar wallets such as MoneyGram, Lobstr, Decaf, and Freedom Pay Wallet will benefit by enabling instant onboarding and transaction execution without additional development.  Using Mesh as an anchor, Stellar wallets can enable users to buy RWA, fund MoneyGram payments, or donate to charities effortlessly.  Our project taps into a combined user base of over 170 million active users across major crypto exchanges integrated via Mesh.  This connectivity provides Stellar wallets with unprecedented access to liquidity and on/off ramp services globally, unlocking significant growth and ecosystem expansion opportunities.  As Stellar targets $3 billion in RWA tokenizations by end-2025—up from $290 million earlier this year—this integration will accelerate ecosystem growth through scalable cross-exchange onboarding powered by Mesh’s proven API infrastructure, simplifying digital asset participation and driving Stellar’s expanding impact, benefiting the entire Stellar community.
Regions of Operation: Latin America & Caribbean,Sub-Saharan Africa,Europe & Central Asia,North America (without Mexico)
Awarded Submissions: BP Ventures, Universal Mesh Integration for Stellar
Open-Source?: Partly, I do have a public Github

Title: Volta Circuit
Description: Volta Circuit is a non-custodial, smart contract-based security platform designed to enable secure asset management, DeFi participation, and cross-chain mobility. Modeled after Gnosis Safe, our architecture ensures users maintain full control over their assets through programmable, on-chain access controls without relying on centralized custodians.  We seek support to integrate Stellar into Volta Circuit, extending our secure, multi-signature smart contract capabilities to the Stellar network. This will allow users to safely store and manage Stellar-based assets, interact with Stellar-native DeFi protocols, and facilitate trustless cross-chain transactions.  Implementation Highlights Non-custodial, multi-signature smart contract wallets for Stellar assets On-chain policy enforcement for secure, automated transaction approvals Cross-chain interoperability, enabling seamless asset transfers between Stellar and other blockchains DeFi-ready architecture, allowing institutional and individual users to engage with Stellar-based financial applications securely By adding Stellar support, Volta Circuit will enhance secure, non-custodial asset management and bridge DeFi ecosystems across chains, unlocking new liquidity opportunities for users and developers alike. 🚀

The development team combines decades of experience from leading technology companies including Bird, TruCar, and ZipRecruiter, with strong backgrounds in mathematics, computer science, and blockchain development. Title: Range: Cross-chain intelligence platform
Description: This proposal seeks to build a Steller Bridge Explorer, and integrate Stellar with Range’s Cross-Chain Explorer and Range Trail, our cross-chain, cross-ecosystem, real-time forensic intelligence platform.
Open-Source?: No, my project does not need to be open-source, now or in the future
Team Description:
Range is a leading blockchain intelligence and monitoring platform for the Ethereum, Solana and Cosmos ecosystems.  

Range brings extensive experience in Rust development, as well as deep proficiency in L1 and cross-chain integrations. Our clients and trusted partners include the Solana Foundation, Circle, dYdX, Celestia, Squads, Osmosis, Noble, Cosmos Hub, and more.   

Our products are natively cross-chain. To solve the frustration of tracking cross-chain transfers, we launched the first Cross-Chain Explorer - consolidating data from 50+ major ecosystems and 4 leading interoperability protocols, offering real-time insights into cross-chain transactions, all in one place. Developers and Product Teams can then leverage our API to integrate real-time transaction tracking and build custom analytics directly into their applications.  

We provide critical infrastructure across the risk and security lifecycle to help organizations and users build and use cutting-edge financial applications safely:  

-   With its advanced explorer, Risk APIs, real-time monitoring and alerts, the Range Platform helps secure over $31 billion in assets.
    
-   Range Trail, our cross-chain forensic wallet monitoring tool, is used by multiple teams to respond to incidents and identify stolen funds in security hacks. 
    
-   Our USDC Explorer is the primary explorer for Circle's CCTP protocol. It helps users track cross-chain stablecoin transfers daily across Ethereum, Solana, Base, Arbitrum, Polygon, Cosmos and many other ecosystems.
    
-   Our IBC Rate Limit contracts secure every transaction across Cosmos’s Osmosis and Neutron chains, limiting the potential damage caused by a hack. 
    

Our Risk APIs form the backbone of the new Solana Transaction Security Standard, which Squads Protocol adopted to secure its users, who have over $10 billion in combined assets. Squads and other teams rely on our Risk API to secure more than $100 million in stablecoin transactions monthly, ensuring real-time risk assessment and proactive threat mitigation across the Solana ecosystem.

Title: Upwealth
Description: Upwealth is an AI-powered, Web3-native investment and management platform registered SEC (US) and AMF (EU) designed for financial professionals (RIAs, wealth managers) to seamlessly offer digital asset investments to their customers.  Vision & Objectives: Upwealth aims to bridge traditional finance and Web3, allowing professionals to offer, manage, and automate digital asset portfolios through Smart Contract SMAs and AI-driven investment tools—all within a regulated, secure, and scalable environment.  We have implemented an off-chain proof-of-concept showcasing Upwealth’s crypto asset management and trading capabilities, including:  • A trading engine connected via API to CEXs and DEXs for automated order execution.  • A portfolio rebalancing and backtesting module optimizing investment strategies.  • An asset aggregator enabling customers to connect 350+ protocols, wallets, and exchange accounts for a unified portfolio view.   We plan to integrate on-chain operations by:  • Connecting Soroban to Upwealth for decentralized portfolio management via smart contracts. • Enhancing DeFi and on-chain liquidity through Stellar’s AMMs, and leveraging platforms such as Allbridge (cross-chain bridge) and Blend Protocol for seamless asset transfers and liquidity access.

Title: Stellar Integration in Adamik API
Description: Adamik is a blockchain-agnostic, non-custodial API that radically simplifies integration for wallets, custodians, and exchanges. Instead of building custom infrastructure for each chain, developers use Adamik to access 60+ blockchains through a single, unified interface.  Our API exposes standardized endpoints for retrieving balances, preparing transactions, and managing staking — all abstracted from the complexity of protocol-specific logic. We are signer-agnostic by design and fully compatible with industry-grade solutions like Ledger, Fireblocks, Turnkey, Sodot, and DFNS.  With this project, we aim to make Stellar (XLM) natively accessible via the Adamik API — enabling developers to add Stellar support in days, not weeks, while maintaining full compatibility with their existing signing and security infrastructure.
Open-Source?: Partly, I do have a public Github
Team Description:
The Adamik team is composed of blockchain infrastructure veterans with deep expertise in protocol integration. Our core team previously led and delivered multiple protocol integrations at Ledger, including the Stellar (XLM) integration for both Ledger Live and Ledger Enterprise, as well as several reviews on the Ledger Stellar application running on the hardware wallets.  

-   Fabrice Dautriat (CEO) – Former Head of Developer Ecosystem at Ledger, with 6 years at the company overseeing integrations across hardware, software, and infrastructure.

Title: zkFetch: zkTLS-Powered Oracle Solution
Description: zkFetch leverages zkTLS infrastructure to democratize and scale Stellar oracles by enabling fetching of any off-chain data from HTTPS endpoints while not exposing API keys. This enables a truly decentralized oracle infrastructure removing any dependency on centralized oracles such as Chainlink, Pyth etc.
Submissions: zkFetch: zkTLS-Powered Oracle Solution,zkFetch: zkTLS-Powered Oracle Solution
Awarded Submissions: zkFetch: zkTLS-Powered Oracle Solution, Reclaim Protocol
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github
Team Description:
Our team's expertise and Reclaim Protocol's proven track record uniquely position us to deliver zkFetch integration for Stellar with high trust and accountability:

Capabilities:

1.  Unparalleled zkTLS Infrastructure: Reclaim is the only production-ready zkTLS infrastructure, capable of generating zk proofs and data attestations in under 4 seconds, even on low-compute devices.
    
1.  Extensive Blockchain Experience: Our team has successfully deployed Reclaim on multiple chains including Arbitrum, Solana, Optimism, Base, BNB, and Polkadot, demonstrating cross-chain expertise.
    
1.  Stellar-Specific Knowledge: Deep understanding of development on Stellar essential for seamless integration.
    
1.  Proven Scalability: Our devtool allows generation of data templates for any website within 30 minutes, ensuring zkFetch's adaptability to Stellar's diverse needs.
    
1.  Wide-ranging Integrations: Reclaim powers major DID and attestation projects like PolygonID, EAS, BAS, and Gitcoin Passport, showcasing its versatility and reliability.
    
1.  Web2 and Web3 Compatibility: Reclaim SDK seamlessly embeds in both Web2 and Web3 applications, broadening potential use cases for Stellar.
    

Feasibility Validation:

1.  Existing Proof of Concept: We've already developed a Data DAO, testing zkFetch's capabilities with various data feed APIs.
    
1.  Rapid Prototyping: We'll leverage our sub-4-second proof generation capability to quickly develop and iterate on Stellar specific implementations.
    
1.  Phased Testnet Deployment: Incremental deployments on Stellar testnets will allow for continuous validation and refinement.
    
1.  Industry Partnerships: We're actively engaging with leading data providers to integrate them into our platform, ensuring robust real-world testing.
    
1.  Community Engagement: Regular reviews with SCF technical advisors and engagement with the Stellar developer community will provide crucial feedback.
    

Trust and Accountability:

1.  Transparent Reporting: Regular updates on project milestones, including GitHub commits and technical blog posts.
    
1.  Open Communication: Maintaining open channels with the Stellar community for continuous feedback and accountability.
    

we are also recipient of grant for Reclaim in F11

Our team's proven expertise in zkTLS infrastructure, cross-chain deployment experience, demonstrates our capability to successfully integrate zkFetch into Stellar. We're committed to a transparent, community-engaged development process that will deliver a secure, efficient, and transformative oracle solution for the Stellar ecosystem.

We built Questbook.app, an on-chain grants management tool and have been successfully running it for nearly 2 years managing grants for large L1/L2s including Polygon, Compound, Arbitrum, Ton etc. Questbook platform has disbursed more than $3 Mn to more than 250+ developers and engaged with more than 25000 developers.

Title: Moonlight Protocol
Description: Moonlight Protocol is a non-custodial privacy solution built on Stellar, enabling private balances and transactions without sacrificing user control. It is tailored for financial institutions and wallets looking to leverage blockchain while preserving customer privacy. The protocol combines open source on-chain components with off-chain infrastructure, including privacy-preserving transaction bundling and SEP-10-based user authentication for compliance. This architecture allows “privacy providers” (such as wallets or institutions) to shield user identities while remaining fully compliant with regulations. Moonlight's first PoC is already live on the Stellar testnet, with functioning Soroban contracts and other off-chain components to enable private transaction execution demonstrating its feasibility.
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github

Title: Dobprotocol
Description: Dobprotocol is a decentralized protocol that automates the distribution of Real-World Assets (RWA) using artificial intelligence (AI), smart contracts, and blockchain technology. By eliminating intermediaries, Dobprotocol ensures transparent, efficient, and programmable value distribution, redefining how assets are managed and shared in the digital economy.  Our infrastructure integrates Decentralized Finance AI (DeFAI) to optimize capital allocation and financial automation, while Decentralized Autonomous Machines (DAMs) enable autonomous revenue generation and distribution without human intervention. Through blockchain interoperability, Dobprotocol facilitates seamless integration with DeFi ecosystems, tokenization platforms, and automated financial flows.  By leveraging Stellar’s fast, low-cost transactions and global reach, we aim to create a scalable, inclusive financial infrastructure that empowers individuals, businesses, and institutions to access and manage assets with efficiency and transparency.

Title: Aerochain
Description: AeroChain is a blockchain infrastructure built on Stellar, designed to provide full end-to-end traceability for aircraft parts. It aims to become the go-to trust protocol for the aerospace industry.  The system uses a hybrid architecture combining Stellar smart contracts, a business-layer API, and SaaS interfaces for easy integration into existing tools. Each part is assigned a tamper-proof digital identity that records lifecycle events — from manufacturing to maintenance, ownership, and recycling.  AeroChain addresses key industry challenges: regulatory compliance, paperwork, human error, and lack of transparency. It automates compliance documentation, tracks parts in real time, and helps reduce costs and errors by up to 80%.  We target OEMs, MROs, airlines, lessors, and regulators with role-specific tools for certification, authenticity checks, predictive maintenance, and shared audit trails.  We’ve already started developing basic features on Stellar. You can find more technical details in the analytics document.  Our goal is to onboard over 2,000 aerospace players by 2029 and establish AeroChain as the European standard for traceability — leveraging Stellar’s speed, low cost, and energy efficiency

Title: Agnostic
Description: Agnostic is a real-time blockchain analytics platform designed to provide seamless access to on-chain data across EVM-compatible chains, with a mission to eliminate complexity and latency in querying and analyzing blockchain activity by abstracting away data model intricacies and offering a unified, low-latency interface complete with SQL support, visual dashboards, and AI-assisted exploration. Agnostic empowers developers, analysts, and enterprises to unlock meaningful insights from blockchain data effortlessly.  We are now expanding to support non-EVM chains like Stellar. By integrating Stellar into our unified analytics layer, Agnostic will make Stellar’s unique transaction model accessible through the same user-friendly, powerful experience that already supports Ethereum, Base, Arbitrum, and others.  Our platform is used by projects in DeFi, infra, and research sectors, and we’re launching a new AI-native interface for no-code exploration of blockchain datasets. We are open source at the query layer and provide native support for tools like Superset and Grafana.  With support from Stellar, we aim to develop open analytics schemas, data access APIs, and AI-native experiences tailored to the Stellar ecosystem, helping increase developer adoption and visibility for Stellar-based projects.

Title: Token Terminal
Description: Token Terminal is the leading full-stack onchain data platform, trusted by institutions such as Bloomberg, Franklin Templeton, Bitwise, Coinbase, and Ark Invest. Our mission is to build the most comprehensive, accurate, and standardized dataset in crypto—bridging traditional financial analysis with decentralized ecosystems. This project focuses on integrating Stellar’s onchain data into the Token Terminal platform. By indexing and standardizing Stellar blockchain data, we will bring enterprise-grade visibility and analytics tools to the Stellar ecosystem. Our work includes the development of robust data pipelines, long-term data maintenance, and the creation of intuitive dashboards that present Stellar’s network and application-level metrics in a clear, comparable, and actionable format. Beyond data infrastructure, we will produce high-quality educational and analytical content—including dashboards, reports, and API access—tailored for analysts, builders, and investors. This ensures ongoing visibility and accurate benchmarking of Stellar’s performance alongside other leading blockchains and dApps. The impact of this partnership is twofold: First, it strengthens Stellar’s credibility among institutional and retail stakeholders by embedding its data within a globally used analytics standard. Second, it empowers the Stellar builder community with tools to better communicate progress, measure success, and attract funding or users. Together, we’re making Stellar’s ecosystem more transparent, discoverable, and data-driven—laying the groundwork for broader adoption and sustained growth.
Open-Source?: No, my project does not need to be open-source, now or in the future
Team Description:

Title: dolphinze
Description: dolphinze is building the next generation of global payroll infrastructure—designed specifically for contractors and powered by crypto-native rails.  Today’s payroll systems are slow, expensive, and built for a world of full-time employees and legacy banking. They struggle to keep up with how modern companies hire and pay talent—especially across borders. Most providers serve both employees and contractors, juggling complex compliance burdens. And when companies want to pay in crypto, they’re forced to use clunky add-ons or push contractors to external exchanges.  We’re changing that.  dolphinze is a crypto-native, contractor-only platform that helps businesses onboard and pay global contractors in minutes—not weeks. We’ve built a compliant onboarding and payment stack that allows companies to fund payroll in fiat while contractors receive payouts in their preferred currency.  This decoupling of employer funding from contractor payout gives both sides maximum flexibility. Employers can keep their treasury in fiat and maintain clean accounting. Contractors can skip the delays and fees of traditional banking systems and receive funds instantly—wherever they are in the world.  Our mission is simple: make it effortless to pay contractors, anywhere in the world. Fast, flexible, and future-ready.
Open-Source?: Not yet, I don’t have a Github yet but my project will be open-source

Title: Diameter Pay
Description: Diameter Pay is a regulated payments platform providing an API-first infrastructure for USD payments and virtual accounts. Our mission is to create a programmable access layer to the U.S. financial system—connecting foreign banks, PSPs, and stablecoin platforms to Fedwire, ACH, SWIFT, and, soon, Stellar, through a unified, compliance-first interface.  Today, Diameter’s infrastructure enables regulated institutions to access U.S. payment rails safely and transparently, with multi-tier virtual accounts, continuous AML/CFT and sanctions screening, and real-time treasury visibility across multiple U.S. partner banks.  Diameter operates as a licensed Money Services Business (MSB) and New Jersey Money Transmitter, under supervision by the New Jersey Department of Banking and Insurance (NJDOBI). The company has been a third-party participant in FDIC and Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco regulatory exams, has been examined directly by NJDOBI, and has successfully passed independent AML audits, demonstrating robust compliance and operational integrity.  Our customers include leading stablecoin orchestrators and crypto-focused banks in Switzerland and Singapore, who currently manage the on-chain settlement leg via their own infrastructure. With support from the Stellar Community Fund, Diameter will extend this capability in-house, integrating Stellar as a programmable settlement layer for issuing, redeeming, and settling USD-backed assets on-chain under full regulatory oversight.  Diameter is cash-flow positive, processes over $1 billion in monthly transaction volume, and is positioned to bring compliant, programmable money to institutions globally.
Regions of Operation: Latin America & Caribbean,East Asia & Pacific,Europe & Central Asia,North America (without Mexico)
Awarded Submissions: Diameter Stellar: USD to USDC Payments
Open-Source?: No, my project does not need to be open-source, now or in the future

He founded Diameter to modernize global payments access with a compliance-first approach rooted in real-world financial inclusion.  

Our leadership team combines deep institutional and fintech experience. Philipp von Girsewald, former Partner at Deutsche Bank and CEO of Raisin U.S., and Jeff Horvath, former Senior Managing Director of Legal and Compliance at Deutsche Bank and Fitch Ratings, anchor our governance and regulatory framework. Raj Sheth, based in London, leads revenue. Diameter is also onboarding a new compliance officer who formerly ran correspondent banking AML for Deutsche Bank.  

Our engineering organization, headquartered in Poland and led by Rafal Petsch, builds and maintains Diameter’s multi-bank API, ledger, and compliance systems. Senior engineers Jakub Andrzejewski, Jakub Sokołowski, Jakub Miziołek, and Juliusz Kowalewski specialize in payments orchestration, security, and automation.

Our board of directors includes Sandra Ro, CEO of the Global Blockchain Business Council, and Satwik Seshasai, cofounder of Segovia Technology, one of Africa’s original mobile money pioneers.

Title: AI Transparency Token (AITT)
Description: AITT is an open-source solution that certifies the compliance of artificial intelligence systems using the Stellar Soroban blockchain. With the rise of regulations such as the AI Act and GDPR, businesses must demonstrate their commitment to ethics, transparency, and data protection. AITT automates this process by providing an immutable blockchain-based certification registry.    Through its REST API, companies can submit their compliance audits, which are then stored as tamper-proof certificates on the blockchain. Certifications are generated via Soroban smart contracts, issuing non-transferable NFTs to ensure authenticity and prevent falsification. These contracts also enable automatic updates and revocations of certifications if non-compliance is detected in a new audit.    An interactive dashboard allows regulators, investors, and businesses to query the blockchain in real-time to verify certification status. The use of Stellar Soroban ensures optimal scalability and low transaction costs, making adoption accessible to companies of all sizes. This approach eliminates complex manual audits and guarantees a transparent and automated monitoring system for AI compliance.
Open-Source?: Partly, I do have a public Github

Title: Stellar DeFi Dune Dashboards
Description: Right now, most DeFi stats on Stellar come from project-provided reports, which are not always transparent or easy to verify. Platforms like DeFi Llama and DappRadar often rely on these reports instead of pulling data directly from the blockchain. The Stellar DeFi Dune Dashboards will change this by providing fully verifiable, on-chain data from smart contract activity. These dashboards will track important stats like Weekly and Monthly Active Users, Average Slippage on Trades, Percentage of Aggregated Trades, and Liquidity Provider Activity. For AMMs and aggregators, we will show key insights, including trade volume, slippage, price impact, and how often trades go through aggregators instead of single AMMs. We will also track arbitrage profits and how many trades are related to arbitrage. This project will make Stellar DeFi data more transparent and accessible for everyone, helping users, developers, and investors understand how healthy and active the ecosystem really is. We will also maintain and update the dashboards for one year to ensure they stay reliable.
Open-Source?: Yes, fully open-source with Github
Team Description:
We are PaltaLabs 🥑, a hacker hub focused on Stellar. We build DeFi products like the Soroswap.Finance AMM and AMM Aggregator, DeFindex DeFi Investment Vaults, and developer tools like the @soroban-react library and Create Soroban Dapp. Check us out at paltalabs.io.

We manage a team of five full-time developers who are highly active in the community—building dev tools, answering questions, and collaborating with other projects.

Soundness Labs Ltd (soundness.xyz) builds cryptographic infrastructure to make the internet provably secure. The team specializes in zero-knowledge and post-quantum cryptography, developing systems that enable scalable, verifiable, and post-quantum-secure cryptographic infrastructure for blockchains.interoperability.

Its flagship product, Soundness Layer, provides seamless and low-cost proof validity attestations across chains. It leverages Walrus for sequencing and data availability and is deployed on Sui. Soundness Labs has collaborated with Mysten Labs, Sui, and Walrus on joint research and product integrations.

Soundness Labs was co-founded by Alex and Mahdi, who bring extensive experience in zero-knowledge protocol design, cryptographic systems engineering, and blockchain integration.
